content.description: Start matched on a large edge with undercut feet and bump out right to a good incut edge, match and go again to a good flowerpot hold. Juggy horizontals lead up and right to the top.
content.location: Right side of the NE face, and just right of the obvious boulder under the base.

content.description:
Start at the low sidepull flake (shared with

Frank's Direct

and

Frank's Problem

) and once you hit the first sloping rail start a long rightwards traverse to finish up with the last moves of

The Terminator

. The crux comes early on at a sequential series of thin slots and after that it's just a matter of hanging on to finish.

The middle section, while not terribly difficult, does pass over a pile of boulders making a spot particularly helpful.
content.location: Left side of the NE face.

content.description: Sit start with crossed hands on the same start holds as Hesitation Factor. Move directly out right linking into the Terminator.
Sit-start on good incuts and pull through thin crimps to a big throw to a mini jug. Top out on jugs.
content.protection: Three or four pads are needed to form a little nest in the little gully of boulders that you land in.
content.location: Immediately left of Terminator. Sit on the small boulder that the main Frank's Boulder rests on to pull on.

content.description:
Start sitting in the back of the alcove with hands matched on a right-facing flake and rail out to the lip using creative body positioning to a juggy lip encounter and easy climbing above.

A spotter is good as you near the lip to keep you off the dead snag behind the problem.
content.location: Far right side of the NE face, and starting way back in a low alcove behind a downed tree.

content.description:
This easier variation to

Frank's Problem

(V4) shares both the start and finish of that problem but avoids the crux making it a good warm-up for this boulder and the immediate vicinity.

Start at the low sidepull flake (shared with the

Short Sloper Traverse

and

Frank's Direct

) and at the first horizontal move slightly right and then straight up into the upper rail to finish as for Frank's Problem.

The finish, while not terribly difficult, is above a small boulder making a spot particularly helpful.
content.location: Left side of the Northeast Face.

content.description:
Start at the low sidepull flake (shared with the

Short Sloper Traverse

and

Frank's Direct

) and at the first horizontal move right into a sequential series of thin slots (crux) and then straight up to gain the upper rail. Move right to a juggy flake and make some balancy moves to topout.

The finish, while not terribly difficult, is above a small boulder making a spot particularly helpful.
content.protection: pad, a spotter is nice for the finish
content.location: Left side of the Northeast Face.

content.description:
Start at the low sidepull flake (shared with

Frank's Problem

and the

Short Sloper Traverse

) and make a long reach up and out to a slanting rail, match and then move up and left before making the sloping (crux) topout moves.
content.location: Left side of the NE face.
